title: What is the Flavor Triangle?
text: Cocktail flavor comes from balancing three main components: base spirit, sour/bitter ingredients, and sweet ingredients.

title: Base Spirit
text: Base spirits are the foundation of a cocktail. Common ones include tequila, whiskey, gin, and rum.

title: Sour / Bitter
text: Sour components like lime or lemon juice balance sweetness, while bitter ingredients like Campari add depth and complexity.

title: Sweet
text: Sweet ingredients like syrups, liqueurs, or juices round out the drink and balance sour or bitter elements.

title: Margarita
text:
Base spirit: 2 oz Tequila
Sour/Bitter: 1 oz Lime juice
Sweet: 0.75 oz Triple sec or agave syrup

title: Paloma
text:
Base spirit: 2 oz Tequila
Sour/Bitter: 2 oz Grapefruit juice, 0.5 oz Lime juice
Sweet: 0.5 oz Simple syrup

title: Negroni
text:
Base spirit: 1 oz Gin
Sour/Bitter: 1 oz Campari
Sweet: 1 oz Sweet vermouth

title: Whiskey Sour
text:
Base spirit: 2 oz Whiskey
Sour/Bitter: 0.75 oz Lemon juice
Sweet: 0.75 oz Simple syrup
